original: 5.3.6. Atītānāgatavāra🔽Yo dukkhasaccaṁ parijānittha so samudayasaccaṁ pajahissatīti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ dukkha saccam parijānittha saḥ samudaya saccam pajahissati iti no
translated: ... Chapter on the Past and Future🔽Has he who has fully understood the truth of suffering given up the truth of the origin? No.

original: Yo vā pana samudayasaccaṁ pajahissati so dukkhasaccaṁ parijānitthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana samudaya saccam pajahissati saḥ dukkha saccam parijānittha ati no
translated: Or has he who will give up the truth of the origin fully understood the truth of suffering? No.

original: Yo dukkhasaccaṁ na parijānittha so samudayasaccaṁ nappajahissatīti?🔽Ye maggaṁ paṭilabhissanti te dukkhasaccaṁ na parijānittha, no ca te samudayasaccaṁ🔽nappajahissanti. Aggamaggasamaṅgī ye ca puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te dukkhasaccañca
analyzed: yaḥ dukkha saccam na parijānittha saḥ samudaya saccam na ppajahissati iti  ye maggam paṭilabhissanti te dukkha saccam na parijānittha no ca te samudaya sacca  na ppajahissanti agga magga samaṅgī ye ca puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te dukkha saccam ca
translated: Has he who has not fully understood the truth of suffering not given up the truth of the origin?🔽Those who will obtain the path have not fully understood the truth of suffering, but they have not not given up the truth of the origin.

analyzed: na parijānittha samudaya saccam ca na ppajahissanti
translated: Those who are ordinary people and will not obtain the path have not fully understood the truth of suffering and have not given up the truth of the origin.

original: Yo vā pana samudayasaccaṁ nappajahissati so dukkhasaccaṁ na parijānitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana samudaya saccam na pajahissati saḥ dukkha saccam na parijānittha ati
translated: Or has he who will not give up the truth of the origin not fully understood the truth of suffering?🔽The Arahant will not give up the truth of the origin, but he has fully understood the truth of suffering.

original: Arahā samudayasaccaṁ nappajahissati, no ca dukkhasaccaṁ na parijānittha. Aggamaggasamaṅgī
analyzed: arahā samudaya saccam na ppajahissati no ca dukkha saccam na parijānittha agga magga samaṅgī
translated: Those who possess the supramundane path have not given up the truth of the origin, but they have fully understood the truth of suffering.

original: ye ca puthujjanā maggaṁ na paṭilabhissanti te samudayasaccañca nappajahissanti dukkhasaccañca na parijānittha.🔽Pariññāvāro.
analyzed: ye ca puthujjanāḥ maggam na paṭilabhissanti te samudaya saccam ca na pajahissanti dukkha saccam ca na parijānittha  pariññāvāro
translated: And those ordinary people who do not obtain the path will not abandon the truth of the origin, and will not fully understand the truth of suffering.🔽The section on full understanding.
The chapter on the truths is finished.
